results: Modified Szekeres system capable of describing cosmic acceleration
Spatial curvature influenced by minimum length
New asymptotic solutions describing cosmic acceleration
title: Szekeres Universes with GUP Corrections.pdf
abstract: Angamos 0610, Casilla 1280 Antofagasta, Chile (Dated: February 18, 2025) We demonstrate that introducing a deformed algebra with a minimum length modiﬁes the ﬁeld equations for an inhomogeneous spacetime, resulting in the emer- gence of acceleration. Speciﬁcally, we examine the analytic eﬀects of the Generalized Uncertainty Principle on the classical ﬁeld equations of the Szekeres system. Our ﬁndings show that the deformed algebra leads to a modiﬁed Szekeres system capable of describing cosmic acceleration. Moreover, the spatial curvature of the spacetime is inﬂuenced by the presence of the minimum length. PACS numbers: Keywords: Inhomogeneous cosmology, minimum length, acceleration. 1. INTRODUCTION Scalar ﬁeld inﬂation is the main mechanism used to explain the homogeneity and isotropy of the present universe. The scalar ﬁeld dominates in driving the dynamics and explaining the expansion era [1, 2]. Nevertheless, scalar ﬁeld inﬂationary models are primarily deﬁned on homogeneous spacetimes or background spaces with small inhomogeneities [3, 4]. In [5], it was found that the presence of a positive cosmological constant in Bianchi cosmologies leads to expanding Bianchi spacetimes evolving toward the de Sitter universe.
